column3: There are a few things I don't like about this implementation, such as starting the feeCutoff at 0 (instead of 1000 sat/kb).  But I do think an approach like this would work to "solve" this problem in 0.10 and 0.11 backports.  The problem with #6673 is there was no limit to how high the fee went, but if its capped at some value that is still potentially reasonable for a min relay fee (like in this

Starting the feeCutoff at 0 is easily changed, (we can start it anywhere
) but it does rise quite quickly once the mempool is full.  When you
compile and run use debug=mempool and the log entries show you how the
values change as the mempool increases or decreases.
